Title:
Notes on powdery mildews (Erysiphales) in Thailand VI.
Phyllactinia and Leveillula
Keywords:
asexual morph · biodiversity · Erysiphales · phylogeny ·
tropics
Abstract:
This report provides additional list consisting of nine
species of the genus Phyllactinia and one species of Leveillula on
various hosts found in Thailand. Morphological descriptions of powdery
mildew specimens on nine plant families and molecular phylogenetic
analyses based on ITS and 28S rRNA gene sequences are provided.
Phyllactinia macrouri on Morus macroura (Moraceae) and Phyllactinia
broussonetiae-papyriferi on Broussonetia papyrifera (Moraceae) are
proposed as new species. Phyllactinia macrouri differs from Ph. moricola
by having smaller chasmothecia, less number of chasmothecial appendages,
less number of asci per chasmothecium and longer ascospores.
Phyllactinia broussonetiae-papyriferi differs from Ph.
broussonetiae-kaempferi in having shorter conidiophores, foot cells.
Phyllactinia alangii on Alangium kurzii, Ph. dalbergiae on Dalbergia
lanceolaria var. lakhonensis, Phyllactinia cf. ehretiae on Ehretia
laevis, Ph. gmelinae on Gmelina arborea, Ph. moricola on Morus alba, Ph.
pyri-serotinae on Pyrus pyrifolia, Ph. terminaliae on Terminalia
bellirica and Leveillula taurica on Euphorbia heterophylla, Solanum
aculeatissimum and S. torvum, found in Thailand were described. Ehretia
laevis and S. aculeatissimum are new host records for powdery mildews
species in the world.
